SEARCH
Package othellogame.ui

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
othellogame.ui.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The main controller class that manages the flow of the Othello game application, following the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern.

It controls the transition between different scenes, updates the game state, and handles user interactions.

Version:
1.0, 12/07/2023
Author:
Dinh Thuy Nhat Vy
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()
      Constructor for the Controller class.

      Initializes the game model, various views, and sets up the stage.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Controller getInstance()
      Gets the instance of the Controller class (singleton pattern).
      Returns:
      the instance of the Controller class.

    • loadScene

      public void loadScene(String scene, javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      Loads the specified scene based on the provided scene name.
      Parameters:
      scene - the name of the scene to be loaded
      pane - the current pane from which the method is called. It's used to obtain the current stage to set the new scene.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the primary stage to show the current scene.

    • menuSoundControl

      public void menuSoundControl(String currentView)
      Controls the menu sound state for the MenuScene and the OfflinePlayingScene.
      Parameters:
      currentView - the current view (menu view or offline playing view) to determine the sound icon.

    • gameSoundControl

      public void gameSoundControl()
      Controls the game sound state for the OfflinePlayingMainScene.

    • updateCurrentPlayerAnnouncement

      public void updateCurrentPlayerAnnouncement(Mark mark, String name)
      Updates the announcement of the current player in the OfflinePlayingMainScene.
      Parameters:
      mark - the mark (BLACK or WHITE) of the current player.
      name - the name of the current player.

    • handleMove

      public void handleMove(int index)
      Handles the user move in the game.
      Parameters:
      index - the index where the user wants to place a disc.

    • updateCurrentMoveAnnouncement

      public void updateCurrentMoveAnnouncement(boolean validMove, String name, Mark mark, int index)
      Updates the announcement of the current move in the OfflinePlayingMainScene.
      Parameters:
      validMove - indicates whether the move is valid.
      name - the name of the player making the move.
      mark - the mark (BLACK or WHITE) of the player making the move.
      index - the index of the move on the game board.

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard(boolean addDisc, Mark mark, int index)
      Updates the game board in the OfflinePlayingMainScene based on the specified move, indicating whether a disc is added or flipped.
      Parameters:
      addDisc - indicates whether to add a disc to the board. If true, indicates that a disc is added to the specified index; if false, indicates that the disc at the specified index is flipped.
      mark - the mark (BLACK or WHITE) associated with the disc being added or flipped.
      index - the index on the game board where the disc is added or flipped.

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Ends the game and loads the ExitScene.

    • updatePlayersResults

      public void updatePlayersResults(boolean finalResult, int playerIndex, String winner, int totalDiscs, Mark winnerMark, String resignedPlayer)
      Updates the player results in the ExitScene.
      Parameters:
      finalResult - indicates whether the provided result is the final outcome of the game.
      playerIndex - the index of the player.
      winner - the name of the winner.
      totalDiscs - the total number of discs acquired by the player.
      winnerMark - the mark (BLACK or WHITE) of the winner.
      resignedPlayer - the name of the player who resigned, if a player has resigned; otherwise, set to "null".

    • handleQuitGame

      public void handleQuitGame()
      Handles the quitting of the game.
